body.p:
Campbellsville Ky. Septr 25th 1865
Thos E. Bramlett
Governor of Ky.

Your Petitioner Jackson Dye states he purchased some good Apple Brandy for Medical purposes & for his own family in 1864, but at the urgent Solicitation of a friend he sold a pont thereof for like purposes. and for which he has been indicted & confessed judgt at the septr Term 1865 of the Taylor Circuit Court for keeping a tipling house & fined $60. He had no intention of violating the law & did it ignorantly. He is a poor man and asks that the fine (except attys fees & costs) be remited

We personally know that Jackson Dye is a sober, correct & upright & good Citizen of Taylor County, and believe his statements made above, and ask the Governor to remit his fine of $60,,This Septr 25,, 1865.

Joseph H. Chandler
Thos. R. Wright Clk Taylor ct Cort
H J Colvin
Geo W. Aspen
R. H. Martin
J B Mcwhorter S, T, C
J, R, Robinson
